file_content.text: Such skill. So much power. Impressive.
You could kill me. Why hesitate?
You could've killed the scientist and those Jawas at the Shock Drum facility, but you didn't.
Because you're not a killer.
They were not warriors. Their deaths would have been pointless.
The dark side embraces lies and hate. The light side serves honor and truth. We have more in common than you think.
To show you the light side.
Jedi and Sith have no common ground.
I want you to know I've beaten you.
Savoring the victory is fun.
Hesitate much longer, and your victory will be short-lived.
You could be a great Sith if you embraced the dark side.
My strength comes from the light side. It always will.
I'll never join you.
Your resolve is admirable. No wonder my master fears you.
Being a powerful Sith didn't help you much, did it?
The dark side is weak.
You are simply stronger than me.
Perhaps that's how I beat you.
Maybe I already have.
Then my defeat stings much less.
Darth Angral commanded me to destroy the Shock Drum code. He wanted you to die in failure, no matter the outcome here.
I will not tarnish my honor with petty tricks. You've earned better. The code is yours.
Why turn against your master?
You're disobeying Angral.
I serve a higher authority than any master. A Jedi wouldn't understand.
You've done the right thing.
Thank you, Lord Praven.
If you think that will buy you mercy, guess again.
I'm killing you anyway.
A warrior never regrets death. Only dishonor.
Darth Angral ordered that Master Kiwiiks suffer greatly before her death. I wish I had disobeyed that order, as well.
If Master Kiwiiks is still alive, I will save her.
I hope it's not too late.
She never did anything to him.
Such pointless cruelty.
She detected Tarnis on Coruscant. Revenge is all my master understands.
You expect me to believe you care what happens to a Jedi?
Keep your apologies.
She faced me as a warrior. She should die as one.
I left her incapacitated next to your weapon. If they haven't already, the ultrasonic vibrations will eventually tear her apart.
You scum! You should die like that.
There is nothing more to say. You won our duel. Finish me.
You may serve the Empire, but I won't kill you. You don't deserve it.
No. There is good in you.
Then honor demands I surrender to my master. He will do what you cannot.
Jedi are taught to see all possibilities. I see one where you live on with honor.
Embrace the light side.
Commit yourself to the path of light. Become a Jedi.
Look at what your honor and duty has led to. You don't owe that maniac anything.
Don't go back to him.
You could kill me, but refuse. Not out of fear... but compassion.
The things I was taught about the Jedi... were they all lies?
Sith are masters of deception. They've been lying to you since you were born.
Of course they were.
Then my master has much to answer for. Thank you for opening my eyes to the truth.
It's never too late to turn from the dark side.
Join us and find out.
Me, a Jedi? Impossible. Your order would never accept me.
Jedi believe in forgiveness, not hate.
They will, I promise you.
Accepting a sworn enemy into one's ranks without fear... that is strength.
The only way to find out is to ask.
It's worth trying.
I accept your offer.
I'm too wounded to aid you, but I will surrender to your people. Now hurry--save this planet.
The Jedi would never allow something like you to live.
You're right, they wouldn't.
Then I am left with no options at all. So be it.
We're committed to destroying the Sith. That much is true.
Not all of them.
Then why refuse to kill me? Perhaps you're simply mad.
Since you will not honor me with a warrior's death, I will return to my master.
Farewell. We will not meet again.
I'm sure that lunatic will find an especially horrible death for you.
I hope it's painful.
He will not be merciful. So be it.
Farewell, Jedi....
In another life, we might have been friends.
As you wish.
With pleasure.
I am ready. May the Force be with you.
I sense your power. Now I understand why Tarnis was no match for you.
His death was my failure. I should've trained him better.
The other Sith I've fought were full of hatred and arrogance. In you, I sense regret.
You're not what I expected.
My family is true Sith. My only passions are integrity and honor.
I've fought banthas that were deadlier than Tarnis.
That's putting it lightly.
You insult my honor. Good. That makes me more powerful.
The student died easily. I expect his teacher will, too.
I'm going to kill you.
Tarnis was young. He underestimated you. I won't.
I welcome the end of your kind. The Jedi obsession with my people's extermination must end.
Your lust for revenge will destroy this galaxy.
Whatever you've been told about us, it's a lie. We'd gladly stop fighting if it meant genuine peace.
Jedi don't seek revenge.
I'd like to believe that--but I know better.
You don't want this world to be destroyed. Help me save it.
[Force Persuade] Trust me.
I don't want this world to be destroyed. I will help you save it.
Now give me the code so I can deactivate the Shock Drum.
I will give you the code to deactivate the Shock Drum. I also have other things you may find helpful....
Wait... wait... what have you done?
I approached you with honor, and you tricked me! How dare you?
Jedi save lives whenever they can. I was saving yours.
I was avoiding violence.
More lies. You won't confuse me again.
Your honor remains intact. You lost to a superior opponent.
This wasn't personal.
This battle has not yet begun.
If your mind wasn't so weak, it wouldn't have been so easy.
Don't blame me.
I lowered my guard. Never again.
When you challenged me to a duel, I didn't realize you'd fight with words.
Are we here to fight or talk?
You prove my point. When faced with a chance to reason, you'd rather kill.
Come, let us end this. Die well, Jedi.
I am not here for you. Move aside.
